## PRIVACY POLICY

OVERVIEW

This Privacy Policy describes how your personal information is collected,
used, and shared when you visit or make a purchase from this website (“the
website”).

PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT

When you visit the website, we automatically collect certain information about
your device, including information about your web browser, IP address, time
zone, and some of the cookies that are installed on your device.

Additionally,
as you browse the website, we collect information about the individual web
pages or products that you view, what websites or search terms referred you to
the website, and information about how you interact with the website.

We refer
to this automatically-collected information as “Device Information.”

We collect Device Information using the following technologies:

  * “Cookies” are data files that are placed on your device or computer and often include an anonymous unique identifier.
* “Log files” track actions occurring on the website, and collect data including your IP address, browser type, Internet service provider, referring/exit pages, and date/time stamps.
* “Review Tools” track end-user actions, screen information, and browser errors to allow for remote debugging and optimisation.
* “Web beacons,” “tags,” and “pixels” are electronic files used to record information about how you browse the website.

Additionally when you register or create an account, make a purchase, or
attempt to make a purchase through the website, we collect certain information
from you, including your name, billing address, shipping address, payment
information (including credit card numbers, email address, and phone number.

We use the Account Information that we collect generally to fulfill any orders
placed through the website (including processing your payment information,
arranging for shipping, and providing you with invoices and/or order
confirmations).

We specifically maintain
aggregated usage statistics and individual Account Information profiles for
the website via connection to the Intercom service.

We use the Device Information that we collect to help us screen for potential
risk and fraud (in particular, your IP address), and more generally to improve
and optimize our Site (for example, by generating analytics about how our
customers browse and interact with the website, and to assess the success of
our marketing and advertising campaigns).

We use the domain name of your email
address to identify organizations that use our service, and publish some of
these organizational logos on our website.

We also
use Google Analytics to help us understand how our customers use the website--
you can read more about how Google uses your Personal Information here:
[https://www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/](https://www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/?ref=opable.com).

DO NOT TRACK

Please note that we do not alter our site's data collection and use practices
when we see a Do Not Track signal from your browser.

However, the ownership and responsibility of the data
collected through these surveys and forms lie with the creator (our client),
not us.

When you use our services to create and share a survey or form, you
assume the role of data steward, responsible for managing and protecting the
data collected from your respondents.

Similarly, if you are responding to a survey or form created by one of our
clients using our platform, please be aware that you are providing your
information to them, not directly to us.

## PRIVACY POLICY

OVERVIEW

This Privacy Policy describes how your personal information is collected,
used, and shared when you visit or make a purchase from this website (“the
website”).

SHARING YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION

We share your Personal Information with third parties to help us use your
Personal Information, as described above.

Finally, we may also share your Personal Information to comply with applicable
laws and regulations, to respond to a subpoena, search warrant or other lawful
request for information we receive, or to otherwise protect our rights.
